docs.lead_paragraph: Dark money allows both Republicans and Democrats to set up supposed social welfare organizations that are a front for political partisans, providing influence and access without the accountability.

headline.main: The Dark Side of Campaign Financing
headline.print_headline: The Dark Side of Campaign Financing

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG VIEW

docs.lead_paragraph: California's health insurance exchange faced calls Monday for a state investigation of its contracting practices, while a state senator urged the agency to account for deals that steered millions of dollars to a firm whose employees have long-standing ties to the agency's executive director.

headline.main: Probe Sought in California No-Bid Health Contracts
headline.print_headline: Probe Sought in California No-Bid Health Contracts

docs.abstract: I started the #WhyIStayed hashtag because of my dismay while reading tweets in my Twitter feed that blamed Janay Rice for having stayed with Ray Rice. Others have used that hashtag to share their stories. Here’s what I’ve learned.
docs.snippet: I started the #WhyIStayed hashtag because of my dismay while reading tweets in my Twitter feed that blamed Janay Rice for having stayed with Ray Rice. Others have used that hashtag to share their stories. Here’s what I’ve learned.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pennsylvania Governor Tom Corbett is not only trailing his Democratic challenger badly, but he has lost the support of nearly a quarter of his fellow Republicans, according to polls showing his bid for a second term is in deep trouble.

headline.main: In Pennsylvania Race, Republican Governor Cannot Count on His Own
headline.print_headline: In Pennsylvania Race, Republican Governor Cannot Count on His Own

docs.snippet: Pennsylvania Governor Tom Corbett is not only trailing his Democratic challenger badly, but he has lost the support of nearly a quarter of his fellow Republicans, according to polls showing his bid for a second term is in deep trouble.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research poll on health insurance coverage and costs was conducted from July 22 to September 3 by NORC at the University of Chicago. The survey was funded by the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Quindell Plc, a British IT outsourcing and consultancy company, said third-quarter revenue more than doubled, boosted by a jump in sales at both its services and solutions businesses and raised it core profit margin forecast for the full year.

headline.main: Quindell Revenue More Than Doubles; Ups EBITDA Margin Forecast
headline.print_headline: Quindell Revenue More Than Doubles; Ups EBITDA Margin Forecast

docs.lead_paragraph: Some healthcare experts are bristling at the assertion by a top U.S. health official that a “protocol breach” caused a Dallas nurse to be infected with Ebola while caring for a dying patient, saying the case instead shows how far the nation’s hospitals are from adequately training staff to deal with the deadly virus.

headline.main: U.S. CDC Head Criticized for Blaming 'Protocol Breach' as Nurse Gets Ebola
headline.print_headline: U.S. CDC Head Criticized for Blaming 'Protocol Breach' as Nurse Gets Ebola
